title: How to Make Cheesecake Sandwiches

steps.headline: Put the graham cracker halves on the plate.
steps.description: Make sure that they are separated on the line.

steps.headline: Spread the cream cheese on one cracker and spread the jam on the other.
Put both crackers together.
Serve it and enjoy!
Place the slices of sandwich bread on a work surface.
Spread the cream cheese on 2 bread slices.
Spread the strawberry jam or preserves on the other 2 slices.
Press the 2 slices together.
steps.description: Press one cream cheese to one strawberry jam/preserves slice.

steps.headline: Turn on the overhead grill (or broiler).
Spread butter over the top of each sandwich.
Put the buttered side up and grill for about 3 to 4 minutes, or until golden brown.
Remove and butter the other side.
steps.description: Slip back under the grill or broiler for about the same time.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat when golden brown both sides.
Plate up and serve.
steps.description: Allow the diner to cut the sandwich; the cheese will ooze a little. Be careful, as both cheese and jam or preserves will be hot.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 150ºF/300ºC.
steps.description: Line a slice pan with parchment or baking paper.

steps.headline: Arrange half of the lattice biscuits on the base of the pan.
steps.description: The sugared side needs to face downward.

steps.headline: Add the cream cheese, sugar, syrup and vanilla to a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Mix until smooth and all the sugar has dissolved. You can either use an electric mixture or do this by hand.

steps.headline: Add the eggs.
Pour or spoon the creamy mixture across the layer of lattice biscuits.
steps.description: Tap the side to remove any trapped air bubbles.

steps.headline: Finish with another layer of the remaining lattice biscuits.
steps.description: This time, face the sugar side upwards.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 50 minutes or until the cheesecake portion has set.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Let sit for about 10 minutes to slightly cool.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator to chill.
steps.description: It should be refrigerated for at least one hour but can remain in there longer, as needed.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Either place on the table for self-service or pre-slice into separate sandwich portions and plate up individually. Serve with whipped cream and/or fresh berries/fruit.

text: Graham Cracker Cheesecake Sandwich Put the graham cracker halves on the plate. Make sure that they are separated on the line. Spread the cream cheese on one cracker and spread the jam on the other.  Put both crackers together. Press it together firmly. Serve it and enjoy!  Grilled Strawberry Cheesecake Sandwich Place the slices of sandwich bread on a work surface.  Spread the cream cheese on 2 bread slices.  Spread the strawberry jam or preserves on the other 2 slices.  Press the 2 slices together. Press one cream cheese to one strawberry jam/preserves slice. Turn on the overhead grill (or broiler).  Spread butter over the top of each sandwich.  Put the buttered side up and grill for about 3 to 4 minutes, or until golden brown.  Remove and butter the other side. Slip back under the grill or broiler for about the same time. Remove from the heat when golden brown both sides.  Plate up and serve. Allow the diner to cut the sandwich; the cheese will ooze a little. Be careful, as both cheese and jam or preserves will be hot. Salted Caramel Cheesecake Sandwich Preheat the oven to 150ºF/300ºC. Line a slice pan with parchment or baking paper. Arrange half of the lattice biscuits on the base of the pan. The sugared side needs to face downward. Add the cream cheese, sugar, syrup and vanilla to a mixing bowl. Mix until smooth and all the sugar has dissolved. You can either use an electric mixture or do this by hand. Add the eggs. Whisk in to combine thoroughly. Pour or spoon the creamy mixture across the layer of lattice biscuits. Tap the side to remove any trapped air bubbles. Finish with another layer of the remaining lattice biscuits. This time, face the sugar side upwards. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 50 minutes or until the cheesecake portion has set. Remove from the oven. Let sit for about 10 minutes to slightly cool. Place in the refrigerator to chill. It should be refrigerated for at least one hour but can remain in there longer, as needed. Serve. Either place on the table for self-service or pre-slice into separate sandwich portions and plate up individually. Serve with whipped cream and/or fresh berries/fruit.
